body: if it is not available it will default to true, no?
diff_hunk:
@@ -642,7 +642,7 @@ class NetinfoRequestHandler : public BaseRequestHandler
         "  send     Time since last message sent to the peer, in seconds\n"
         "  recv     Time since last message received from the peer, in seconds\n"
         "  txn      Time since last novel transaction received from the peer and accepted into our mempool, in minutes\n"
-        "           \"*\" - whether we relay transactions to this peer (relaytxes is false)\n"
+        "           \"*\" - we do not relay transactions to this peer (relaytxes is false or not available)\n"

body:
@MarcoFalke 
Yes, I was able to verify your point

On line https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/bitcoin-cli.cpp#L542, the `"*"` or `""` is selected based on bool value of `is_tx_relay`.

```cpp
peer.last_trxn ? ToString((time_now - peer.last_trxn) / 60) : peer.is_tx_relay ? "" : "*",
```

and,
on line https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/bitcoin-cli.cpp#L481, `is_tx_relay` defaults to **True** when `relaytxes` is **Null**

```cpp
const bool is_tx_relay{peer["relaytxes"].isNull() ? true : peer["relaytxes"].get_bool()};
```

body: @MarcoFalke @shaavan thanks for taking a look! Addressed your feedback, improved the getpeerinfo#relaytxes help, and added explicitly handling the new (v24.0) relaytxes 3rd state of "not available" in -netinfo.

>     4. Node is setup but we canât relay to it (`m_tx_relay` = **nullptr**)
> 
> The first three states are properly represented by the PR using "", "*", "." repectively. However, I think there is a need to address the 4th state as well in which we can't relay transactions to the peer.

@shaavan thanks for looking. Running `git grep -B4 "stats.m_relay_txs = false;"`, in the 4th case you describe `PeerManagerImpl::GetNodeStateStats()` returns `m_relay_txs` as false (and so getpeerinfo#relaytxes is false). This is one of the 3 states (true, false, not available) returned by that field and handled here.

If relaytxes is omitted ONLY if it hasn't been setup yet, we should just include it as `false` IMO.

(But if it could be during peer *destruction*, that might not be correct)

@luke-jr I tend to agree; nevertheless see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26109#discussion_r973091972 for the rationale, which was considered compelling enough to make getpeerinfo#relaytxes optional after being always present since the API field was introduced in 08843ed99843078acb10eecda2045d5f0f1c2b4f. Edit: I've added the link to the pull description.

Thank you @brunoerg! @MarcoFalke @shaavan mind re-reviewing? @w0xlt @dunxen @kristapsk @1440000bytes @Zero-1729 @0xB10C @jarolrod you have reviewed these kind of changes in the past, if you don't mind having a look.

IMO, it would be worthwhile to use '`.`' to signal we aren't relaying txs (i.e. `relaytxes is false`) and have '`*`' signal the case where the info is unavailable. 

Mainly for two reasons, consistency and intuition. Regarding consistency, `addrp` already uses '`.`' to signal that we aren't relaying addresses (specifically, when `addr_relay_enabled is false`) which is a similar case here, as `relaytxes is false`. Though currently on master, '`*`' is used to show when `relaytxes is false`, it breaks that consistency also, and I'd say '`*`' intuitively seems more like an undetermined/pending state than '`.`'.

@@ -642,7 +643,8 @@ class NetinfoRequestHandler : public BaseRequestHandler
         "  send     Time since last message sent to the peer, in seconds\n"
         "  recv     Time since last message received from the peer, in seconds\n"
         "  txn      Time since last novel transaction received from the peer and accepted into our mempool, in minutes\n"
-        "           \"*\" - whether we relay transactions to this peer (relaytxes is false)\n"
+        "           \".\" - we do not relay transactions to this peer (relaytxes not available as peer connection is still being set up)\n"
+        "           \"*\" - we do not relay transactions to this peer (relaytxes is false)\n"

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26584](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26584) (cli: include local ("unroutable") peers in -netinfo table by pinheadmz)
* [#26516](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26516) (rpc: Always return getpeerinfo "relaytxes" field by jonatack)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Closing for now in favor of #26516.
Re-opening after reading https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26457#issuecomment-1316597000, pending reviewer feedback here and on #26516 (the latter has the benefit of not changing user space).

What are the next steps here?

> pending reviewer feedback here and on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26516 (the latter has the benefit of not changing user space).

The reviewer feedback in #26516 seems to be that the change is either incorrect, or maybe needs better justification.

The [reviewer feedback in this PR](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26328#discussion_r1024197861) seems to be that the tri-state change is unnecessary, because the third state to display `(N/A)`, will never be used, as it's impossible to have missing values during connection setup, as described in the docs added here.
